org.openremote.console.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openremote.console.controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main Controller class used for interacting with a controller; the Controller is used to get panel information and to register/unregister panels
    Author:
    Richard Turner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller(ControllerInfo controllerInfo)
      Create a controller from the specified ControllerInfo
      Controller(ControllerInfo controllerInfo, Credentials credentials)
      Create a controller from the specified ControllerInfo using the specified Credentials for the connection

      Create a controller from the specified string URL
      Controller(java.lang.String url, Credentials credentials)
      Create a controller from the specified string URL using the specified Credentials for the connection

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback)
      Connects to this controller and calls the AsyncControllerCallback with response type of ControllerConnectionStatus callback to be called when finished.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnect from the controller; this will preserve any registrations but their onFailure callbacks will be called to indicate a DISCONNECT has occurred.

      Logout from the controller (i.e.

      Registers the device with this controller (it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the device belongs to this controller; otherwise callbacks will fail or return unexpected results).
      PanelRegistrationHandle registerPanel(Panel panel, AsyncRegistrationCallback callback)
      Registers the panel asynchronously with this controller (it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the panel being registered is loaded into this controller and is up to date.
      static void setConnectorType(java.lang.Class<?> connectorClass) 
      void setCredentials(Credentials credentials)
      Set the Credentials to be used for this connection
      void setTimeout(int timeout)
      Set the timeout for the connection to the controller; default value is 5000.
      void unregisterDevice(DeviceRegistrationHandle registrationHandle)
      Unregisters a device from the controller; no more sensor change notifications will be received and it will no longer be possible to send commands to this device
      void unregisterPanel(PanelRegistrationHandle registrationHandle)
      Unregisters a panel from the controller; no more sensor change notifications will be received and it will not be possible to send commands to the panel widgets or resolve resources.

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Set the timeout for the connection to the controller; default value is 5000. Useful to change this if link/hardware is slow.
        Parameters:

      • registerPanel

        public PanelRegistrationHandle registerPanel(Panel panel,
                                    AsyncRegistrationCallback callback)
        Registers the panel asynchronously with this controller (it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the panel being registered is loaded into this controller and is up to date. If a panel is out of date or isn't loaded into this controller then unpredictable behaviour will occur. Registering means that you will be able to interact with widgets and receive property change notifications from widgets when sensor values change and you will be able to retrieve widget resources from the controller.
        Parameters:
        panel -

      • registerDevice

        public DeviceRegistrationHandle registerDevice(Device device,
                                      AsyncRegistrationCallback callback)
        Registers the device with this controller (it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the device belongs to this controller; otherwise callbacks will fail or return unexpected results). Registering means that you will be able to send commands to the device and you will receive notification of sensor value changes.
        Parameters:
        device -

      • unregisterPanel

        public void unregisterPanel(PanelRegistrationHandle registrationHandle)
        Unregisters a panel from the controller; no more sensor change notifications will be received and it will not be possible to send commands to the panel widgets or resolve resources.
        Parameters:
        registrationHandle -

      • unregisterDevice

        public void unregisterDevice(DeviceRegistrationHandle registrationHandle)
        Unregisters a device from the controller; no more sensor change notifications will be received and it will no longer be possible to send commands to this device
        Parameters:
        registrationHandle -

      • getControllerUrl

        public java.net.URL getControllerUrl()
        Gets the URL of the controller
        Returns:
        URL of controller

      • connect

        public void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback)
        Connects to this controller and calls the AsyncControllerCallback with response type of ControllerConnectionStatus callback to be called when finished. Using the specified timeout for the connection attempt. Any already registered panels will resume monitoring when the connection is re-established.
        Parameters:
        callback -

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from the controller; this will preserve any registrations but their onFailure callbacks will be called to indicate a DISCONNECT has occurred.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Indicates if this controller is currently connected
        Returns:
        is connected.
